operations.summary: Retrieve a specific Request by ID
Delete a specific Request by ID and return the deleted Request
Retrieve the list of all requests
Create or update a Singularity Request

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The Singularity request to create or update

responseMessages.message: Request object is being cleaned. Try again shortly

operations.summary: Bounce a specific Singularity request. A bounce launches replacement task(s), and then kills the original task(s) if the replacement(s) are healthy.
Delete/cancel the expiring bounce. This makes the bounce request permanent.

responseMessages.message: No Request or expiring bounce request for that ID

operations.summary: Schedule a one-off or scheduled Singularity request for immediate execution.

responseMessages.message: Singularity Request is not scheduled or one-off

operations.summary: Retrieve an active task by runId
Pause a Singularity request, future tasks will not run until it is manually unpaused. API can optionally choose to kill existing tasks

responseMessages.message: Request is already paused or being cleaned

operations.summary: Delete/cancel the expiring pause. This makes the pause request permanent.

responseMessages.message: No Request or expiring pause request for that ID

operations.summary: Update the skipHealthchecks field for the request, possibly temporarily
Delete/cancel the expiring skipHealthchecks. This makes the skipHealthchecks request permanent.

responseMessages.message: No Request or expiring skipHealthchecks request for that ID

operations.summary: Unpause a Singularity Request, scheduling new tasks immediately
Immediately exits cooldown, scheduling new tasks immediately
Retrieve the list of active requests
Retrieve the list of paused requests
Retrieve the list of requests in system cooldown
Retreive the list of finished requests (Scheduled requests which have exhausted their schedules)
Retrieve the list of pending requests
Retrieve the list of requests being cleaned up
Delete/cancel the expiring scale. This makes the scale request permanent.

responseMessages.message: No Request or expiring scale request for that ID

operations.summary: Scale the number of instances up or down for a specific Request

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Object to hold number of instances to request

operations.summary: Delete/cancel the expiring skipHealthchecks. This makes the skipHealthchecks request permanent.

responseMessages.message: No Request or expiring skipHealthchecks request for that ID

operations.summary: Update the skipHealthchecks field for the request, possibly temporarily
Retrieve the list of tasks being cleaned from load balancers.

skipHealthchecks.description: If set to true, healthchecks will be skipped for all tasks for this request until reversed

durationMillis.description: The number of milliseconds to wait before reversing the effects of this action (letting it expire)

actionId.description: An id to associate with this action for metadata purposes

message.description: A message to show to users about why this action was taken

name.description: Name of the shell command to run

options.description: Additional options related to the shell command

user.description: User who requested the shell command

logfileName.description: File name for shell command output

message.description: A message to show to users about why this action was taken

actionId.description: An id to associate with this action for metadata purposes

skipHealthchecks.description: Instruct new tasks that are scheduled immediately while executing cooldown to skip healthchecks

message.description: A message to show to users about why this action was taken

actionId.description: An id to associate with this action for metadata purposes

skipHealthchecks.description: If set to true, instructs new tasks that are scheduled immediately while unpausing to skip healthchecks

containerPortType.description: Container port. Use the port number provided (LITERAL) or the dynamically allocated port at this index (FROM_OFFER)

hostPortType.description: Host port. Use the port number provided (LITERAL) or the dynamically allocated port at this index (FROM_OFFER)

containerPort.description: Port number, or index of port from offer within the container

hostPort.description: Port number, or index of port from offer on the host

protocol.description: Protocol for binding the port. Default is tcp

cmd.description: Command for the custom executor to run

embeddedArtifacts.description: A list of the full content of any embedded artifacts

externalArtifacts.description: A list of external artifacts for the executor to download

s3Artifacts.description: List of s3 artifacts for the executor to download

successfulExitCodes.description: Allowable exit codes for the task to be considered FINISHED instead of FAILED

user.description: Run the task process as this user

extraCmdLineArgs.description: Extra arguments in addition to any provided in the cmd field

sigKillProcessesAfterMillis.description: Send a sigkill to a process if it has not shut down this many millis after being sent a term signal

maxTaskThreads.description: Maximum number of threads a task is allowed to use

preserveTaskSandboxAfterFinish.description: If true, do not delete files in the task sandbox after the task process has terminated

maxOpenFiles.description: Maximum number of open files the task process is allowed

skipLogrotateAndCompress.description: If true, do not run logrotate or compress old log files

s3ArtifactSignatures.description: A list of signatures use to verify downloaded s3artifacts

logrotateFrequency.description: Run logrotate this often. Can be HOURLY, DAILY, WEEKLY, MONTHLY

message.description: A message to show to users about why this action was taken

runId.description: An id to associate with this request which will be associated with the corresponding launched tasks

commandLineArgs.description: Command line arguments to be passed to the task

skipHealthchecks.description: If set to true, healthchecks will be skipped for this task run

resources.description: Override the resources from the active deploy for this run

instances.description: The number of instances to scale to

skipHealthchecks.description: If set to true, healthchecks will be skipped while scaling this request (only)

bounce.description: Bounce the request to get to the new scale

incremental.description: If present and set to true, old tasks will be killed as soon as replacement tasks are available, instead of waiting for all replacement tasks to be healthy

durationMillis.description: The number of milliseconds to wait before reversing the effects of this action (letting it expire)

actionId.description: An id to associate with this action for metadata purposes

message.description: A message to show to users about why this action was taken

id.description: A unique id for the request

requestType.description: The type of request, can be SERVICE, WORKER, SCHEDULED, ON_DEMAND, or RUN_ONCE

owners.description: A list of emails for the owners of this request

numRetriesOnFailure.description: For scheduled jobs, retry up to this many times if the job fails

schedule.description: A schedule in cron, RFC5545, or quartz format

scheduleType.description: The type of schedule associated with the scheduled field. Can be CRON, QUARTZ, or RFC5545

scheduleTimeZone.description: Time zone to use when running the

killOldNonLongRunningTasksAfterMillis.description: For non-long-running request types, kill a task after this amount of time if it has been put into CLEANING and has not shut down

taskExecutionTimeLimitMillis.description: If set, don't allow any taks for this request to run for longer than this amount of time

scheduledExpectedRuntimeMillis.description: Expected time for a non-long-running task to run. Singularity will notify owners if a task exceeds this time

waitAtLeastMillisAfterTaskFinishesForRes.description: When a scheduled job finishes, wait at least this long before rescheduling it

instances.description: A count of tasks to run for long-running requests

skipHealthchecks.description: If true, do not run healthchecks

rackSensitive.description: Spread instances for this request evenly across separate racks

rackAffinity.description: If set, prefer this specific rack when launching tasks

slavePlacement.description: Strategy for determining where to place new tasks. Can be SEPARATE, OPTIMISTIC, GREEDY, SEPARATE_BY_DEPLOY, or SEPARATE_BY_REQUEST

requiredSlaveAttributes.description: Only allow tasks for this request to run on slaves which have these attributes

allowedSlaveAttributes.description: Allow tasks to run on slaves with these attributes, but do not restrict them to only these slaves

loadBalanced.description: Indicates that a SERVICE should be load balanced

group.description: Auth group associated with this request. Users in this group are allowed read/write access to this request

requiredRole.description: Mesos Role required for this request. Only offers with the required role will be accepted to execute the tasks associated with the request

readWriteGroups.description: Users in these groups are allowed read/write access to this request

readOnlyGroups.description: Users in these groups are allowed read only access to this request

bounceAfterScale.description: Used for SingularityUI. If true, automatically trigger a bounce after changing the request's instance count

emailConfigurationOverrides.description: Overrides for email recipients by email type for this request

taskLogErrorRegex.description: Searching for errors in task logs to include in emails using this regex

taskLogErrorRegexCaseSensitive.description: Determines if taskLogErrorRegex is case sensitive

taskPriorityLevel.description: a priority level from 0.0 to 1.0 for all tasks associated with the request

maxTasksPerOffer.description: Do not schedule more than this many tasks using a single offer from a single mesos slave

allowBounceToSameHost.description: If set to true, allow tasks to be scheduled on the same host as an existing active task when bouncing

S3ArtifactSignature.description: A file with name `filename` containing the signature (e.g. gpg signature) for an artifact with the specified `artifactFilename`. Used to verify the validity of the artifact being downloaded

requestId.description: Singularity Request Id which is associated with this deploy.

metadata.description: Map of metadata key/value pairs associated with the deployment.

containerInfo.description: Container information for deployment into a container.

customExecutorResources.description: Resources to allocate for custom mesos executor

command.description: Command to execute for this deployment.

uris.description: List of URIs to download before executing the deploy command.

labels.description: Labels for all tasks associated with this deploy

mesosLabels.description: Labels for all tasks associated with this deploy

taskLabels.description: (Deprecated) Labels for specific tasks associated with this deploy, indexed by instance number

mesosTaskLabels.description: Labels for specific tasks associated with this deploy, indexed by instance number

taskEnv.description: Map of environment variable overrides for specific task instances.

healthcheckUri.description: Deployment Healthcheck URI, if specified will be called after TASK_RUNNING.

healthcheckIntervalSeconds.description: Time to wait after a failed healthcheck to try again in seconds.

healthcheckTimeoutSeconds.description: Single healthcheck HTTP timeout in seconds.

healthcheckPortIndex.description: Perform healthcheck on this dynamically allocated port (e.g. 0 for first port), defaults to first port

healthcheckMaxRetries.description: Maximum number of times to retry an individual healthcheck before failing the deploy.

healthcheckMaxTotalTimeoutSeconds.description: Maximum amount of time to wait before failing a deploy for healthchecks to pass.

skipHealthchecksOnDeploy.description: Allows skipping of health checks when deploying.

deployHealthTimeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds that Singularity waits for this service to become healthy (for it to download artifacts, start running, and optionally pass healthchecks.)

considerHealthyAfterRunningForSeconds.description: Number of seconds that a service must be healthy to consider the deployment to be successful.

serviceBasePath.description: The base path for the API exposed by the deploy. Used in conjunction with the Load balancer API.

loadBalancerGroups.description: List of load balancer groups associated with this deployment.

loadBalancerPortIndex.description: Send this port to the load balancer api (e.g. 0 for first port), defaults to first port

loadBalancerOptions.description: Map (Key/Value) of options for the load balancer.

loadBalancerDomains.description: List of domains to host this service on, for use with the load balancer api

loadBalancerAdditionalRoutes.description: Additional routes besides serviceBasePath used by this service

loadBalancerTemplate.description: Name of load balancer template to use if not using the default template

loadBalancerServiceIdOverride.description: Name of load balancer Service ID to use instead of the Request ID

loadBalancerUpstreamGroup.description: Group name to tag all upstreams with in load balancer

deployInstanceCountPerStep.description: deploy this many instances at a time

deployStepWaitTimeMs.description: wait this long between deploy steps

autoAdvanceDeploySteps.description: automatically advance to the next target instance count after `deployStepWaitTimeMs` seconds

maxTaskRetries.description: allowed at most this many failed tasks to be retried before failing the deploy

shell.description: Override the shell property on the mesos task

killTasks.description: If set to false, tasks will be allowed to finish instead of killed immediately

runShellCommandBeforeKill.description: Attempt to run this shell command on each task before it is shut down

durationMillis.description: The number of milliseconds to wait before reversing the effects of this action (letting it expire)

actionId.description: An id to associate with this action for metadata purposes

message.description: A message to show to users about why this action was taken

type.description: Container type, can be MESOS or DOCKER. Default is MESOS

volumes.description: List of volumes to mount. Applicable only to DOCKER container type

docker.description: Information specific to docker runtime settings

portIndex.description: Perform healthcheck on this dynamically allocated port (e.g. 0 for first port), defaults to first port

portNumber.description: Perform healthcheck on this port (portIndex cannot also be used when using this setting)

startupTimeoutSeconds.description: Consider the task unhealthy/failed if the app has not started responding to healthchecks in this amount of time

startupDelaySeconds.description: Wait this long before issuing the first healthcheck

startupIntervalSeconds.description: Time to wait after a failed healthcheck to try again in seconds.

intervalSeconds.description: Time to wait after a valid but failed healthcheck response to try again in seconds.

responseTimeoutSeconds.description: Single healthcheck HTTP timeout in seconds.

maxRetries.description: Maximum number of times to retry an individual healthcheck before failing the deploy.

failureStatusCodes.description: Fail the healthcheck with no further retries if one of these status codes is returned

incremental.description: If present and set to true, old tasks will be killed as soon as replacement tasks are available, instead of waiting for all replacement tasks to be healthy

skipHealthchecks.description: Instruct replacement tasks for this bounce only to skip healthchecks

runShellCommandBeforeKill.description: Attempt to run this shell command on each task before it is shut down

durationMillis.description: The number of milliseconds to wait before reversing the effects of this action (letting it expire)

actionId.description: An id to associate with this action for metadata purposes

message.description: A message to show to users about why this action was taken

privileged.description: Controls use of the docker --privleged flag

network.description: Docker netowkr type. Value can be BRIDGE, HOST, or NONE

forcePullImage.description: Always run docker pull even if the image already exists locally

dockerParameters.description: Other docker run command line options to be set

message.description: A message to show to users about why this action was taken

actionId.description: An id to associate with this action for metadata purposes
